summary: The document, classified as confidential under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, provides details on the movements of Cuban officials in Stockholm, Sweden. It includes information on the arrival and departure of Cuban diplomats and their family members, highlighting specific cases such as the PCS arrival of Cuban Ambassador Quintin Pino Nachado and his wife, and the departure of two Cuban officials without their 201 numbers. The document also notes the lack of information regarding the temporary or PCS departure of Ambassador Oscar Emilio Alcalde-Valls and requests further action for indexing and tracing concerning these individuals.
key_findings: Details the PCS (Permanent Change of Station) arrival of Cuban Ambassador Quintin Pino Nachado and his wife in Stockholm.
Mentions the departure of two Cuban officials from Sweden without providing their 201 numbers.
Indicates that the station had not been advised of the temporary or PCS departure of Ambassador Oscar Emilio Alcalde-Valls.
Requests indexing and tracing for passage liaison concerning the mentioned individuals.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
